byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and MITCH SMITH

abstract: Illinois Gov Bruce Rauner issues executive order banning unions from requiring all state workers to pay equivalent amount of union dues; ban will affect around 6,500 employees who are not in unions but pay fees; order is Rauner's first step in challenging power of public sector unions and follows in footsteps of other Republican governors; labor leaders say fees charged to non-union state employees are fair as those employees benefit from collective bargaining agreements.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Bruce Rauner’s executive order would ban unions from requiring all state workers to pay the equivalent of dues.

headline.main: Illinois Governor Acts to Curb Power of Public Sector Unions
headline.print_headline: Illinois Governor Acts to Curb Power of Public Sector Unions

snippet: Gov. Bruce Rauner’s executive order would ban unions from requiring all state workers to pay the equivalent of dues.

keywords.value: American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees
